Class ChatManagerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.dao.support.DaoSupport

    Observer, ChatManager, EntitySummary, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean

      • createNewChannel

        public ChatChannel createNewChannel(String context,
                           String title,
                           boolean placementDefaultChannel,
                           boolean checkAuthz,
                           String placement)
                             throws PermissionException
        Creates a new ChatChannel but doesn't put it in the database. To persist the channel, call updateChannel().
        Specified by:
        createNewChannel in interface ChatManager
        Parameters:
        context - Id of what the channel is linked to
        title - String the title of the channel
        placementDefaultChannel - boolean to set this as the default channel in the context
        checkAuthz - boolean indicating if we should check for authorization before creating the channel
        placement - String id of the tool placement
        Returns:
        ChatChannel the new un-saved channel
        Throws:
        PermissionException

      • getChannelMessages

        public List<ChatMessage> getChannelMessages(ChatChannel channel,
                                   String context,
                                   Date date,
                                   int start,
                                   int max,
                                   boolean sortAsc)
                                     throws PermissionException
        Description copied from interface: ChatManager
        gets all the messages from the Channel after the passed date, limited to returning the the default maximum number of messages (100), use ChatManager.getChannelMessagesCount(ChatChannel, String, Date) to find the total number of messages
        Specified by:
        getChannelMessages in interface ChatManager
        Parameters:
        channel - the ChatChannel to get messages for
        context - [OPTIONAL] Context of channel and messages to return (only used if the channel is null)
        date - [OPTIONAL] Date that the messages need to be newer than, includes all messages if null
        start - The item to start on (supports paging)
        max - The maximum number of items to return, uses the default maximum if above the default max or < 0, returns none if set to 0
        sortAsc - Boolean to sort the records in ascending order
        Returns:
        List of ChatMessages
        Throws:
        PermissionException

      • getChannelMessages

        protected List<ChatMessage> getChannelMessages(ChatChannel channel,
                                   Date date,
                                   int start,
                                   int max,
                                   boolean sortAsc)
                                        throws PermissionException
        Throws:
        PermissionException
        See Also:

        context - [OPTIONAL] Context of channel and messages to return (only used if the channel is null)

      • update

        public void update(Observable o,
          Object arg)
        This method is called whenever the observed object is changed. An application calls an Observable object's notifyObservers method to have all the object's observers notified of the change. This operates within its own Thread so normal rules and conditions don't apply
        Specified by:
        update in interface Observer
        Parameters:
        o - the observable object.
        arg - an argument passed to the notifyObservers method.
